result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Arrowood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM270 @ 3:00 Parties have received revocation summary. Brief recess 3:05. Resume 3:07. Court has reviewed revocation summary. No additions or corrections by parties. State gives recommendation - ct 1 - 225 days jail, ct 2 - 225 days jail, concurrent. Atty Schuster agrees. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Will approve agreement. Ct 1 - 225 days jail. Ct 2 - 225 days jail, concurrent to ct 1. 67 days sentence credit. Civil judgment for court obligations. Huber. Request by Atty Schuster regarding huber. Court orders huber as allowed by jail. 

3:20 Court calls 16CM107, 16CM147, 16CM134 and 16CM135. Statement of negotiated plea filed. Agreement stated 16CM107- plea to ct 1, 15 days jail consecutive to 15CM270, court costs, ct 2 dismiss and read in. No sentence credit. 16CM147 ct s 1 & 2 withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, comply with orders in Langlade Co case 16JC19, costs. Cts 3 & 4 and 16CM134 and 16CM135 dismissed and read in. No sentence credit in 16CM147. Atty Schuster and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. 16CM107 ct 1 - guilty plea. 16CM147 ct 1 - guilty plea, 16CM147 ct 2 - guilty plea. Cts 3 & 4 dismissed and read in. 16CM107 ct 2 dismissed and read in. 16CM134 and 16CM135 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 16CM107 ct 1, 16CM147 cts 1 & 2. Sentencing remarks by State. Court questions counsel about condition of probation. Sentencing remarks by Atty Schuster. Nothing by Defendant. 16CM107 ct 1 - Court approves agreement. 15 days jail consecutive to 15CM270, huber. No credit for time served. Court costs including DNA surcharge. Pmt plan. First pmt due in October. 16CM147 Court approves agreement. Ct 1 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required. No credit for time served. Court will not order compliance with chips order as condition of probation, gives reasons. Court costs. DNA surcharge. Ct 2 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, same conditions as ct 1. No credit for time served. Def believes has already given DNA sample, form still completed.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court  via video, with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CM107, 16CM134, 16CM135 and 16CM147.  Statement by Atty Schuster in regards to bond.  Request to amend to signature bond.  Response by State.  Court will amend.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.   Bond will cover all files.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cases called 16CM134, 16CM135, 16CM147.  Complaints received, reviewed and waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered to all counts.  Court will receive not guilty pleas.  Bond will continues  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick M Arrowood in court via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM134, 16CM135 and New complaint @ 2:27 p.m. Warrant in 16CM135. Court reviews new charges and possible penalties. Court vacates warrant. State heard on bond. Court questions Def on ability to post bond. Def explains why he missed Court. Court sets bond to cover these three files. Bond in 16CM107 remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 16CM134 & 16CM135.  Atty tried to contact the def.  Def is not present.  Called at 2:32 pm.  Bonds have been set for both cases.  State is requesting warrants, bond $500. or body.  Court will authorize warrant, $500. Adjacent counties
